metadata.title: CVE-2016-3622 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The fpAcc function in tif_predict.c in the tiff2rgba tool in LibTIFF 4.0.6and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(divide-by-zero error) via a crafted TIFF image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3622` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6').
